pr_title: Add Annotation for System Environment Variables

timeline.bodyText: Cool that we test on an additional OS now! 👍
timeline.author: nipafx

replies.bodyText: I think they working on windows support too but it is not ready as you can see in this build Windows OpenJDK 11
replies.author: Hancho2009

timeline.bodyText: Why does this combination have to be excluded?
timeline.author: nipafx
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -1,9 +1,19 @@
 language: java
 
+os:
+  - linux
+  - osx
+
 jdk:
+  - oraclejdk11
   - openjdk8
   - openjdk11
 
+matrix:
+  exclude:
+    - os: osx
+      jdk: openjdk8

replies.bodyText:
This combination is not supported by travis-ci. See here

$ ~/bin/install-jdk.sh [...] --feature "8" [...]
Expected feature release number in range of 9 to 15, but got: 8

Unfortunately travis ci only supports OpenJDK 9 to 15 for osx.
replies.author: Hancho2009

timeline.bodyText: Why do we test on another JDK 11?
timeline.author: nipafx
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -1,9 +1,19 @@
 language: java
 
+os:
+  - linux
+  - osx
+
 jdk:
+  - oraclejdk11

replies.bodyText:
I thought I read that the Implementations can be different so I added this. oraclejdk8 is not supported for osx and linux (I think if a different distro is used than it is possible).
in retrospect I may be confusing this with different platforms.
So I guess the implementations are probably the same and cause no harm if you want to remove it.
replies.author: Hancho2009

replies.bodyText: OpenJDK 11 and Oracle JDK 11 are very similar and I'm willing to bet that they behave the same here, so let's remove this JDK to reduce build times.
replies.author: nipafx

replies.bodyText:
The code did not work on linux (and osx I think) and a test failed but only the first line of the exception was shown and not the full stacktrace. You can see it here:

> Task :test

org.junitpioneer.jupiter.EnvironmentVariableExtensionTests > initializationError FAILED
    java.lang.NullPointerException at EnvironmentVariableExtensionTests.java:34

123 tests completed, 1 failed, 1 skipped


With the change you can see it here:

> Task :test

org.junitpioneer.jupiter.EnvironmentVariableExtensionTests > initializationError FAILED
    java.lang.NullPointerException
        at sun.reflect.UnsafeFieldAccessorImpl.ensureObj(UnsafeFieldAccessorImpl.java:57)
        at sun.reflect.UnsafeQualifiedObjectFieldAccessorImpl.get(UnsafeQualifiedObjectFieldAccessorImpl.java:38)
        at java.lang.reflect.Field.get(Field.java:393)
        at org.junitpioneer.jupiter.EnvironmentVariableUtils.getFieldValue(EnvironmentVariableUtils.java:102)
        at org.junitpioneer.jupiter.EnvironmentVariableUtils.setInSystemEnvClass(EnvironmentVariableUtils.java:94)
        at org.junitpioneer.jupiter.EnvironmentVariableUtils.tryProcessEnvironmentClassFallbackSystemEnvClass(EnvironmentVariableUtils.java:76)
        at org.junitpioneer.jupiter.EnvironmentVariableUtils.modifyEnvironmentVariables(EnvironmentVariableUtils.java:63)
        at org.junitpioneer.jupiter.EnvironmentVariableUtils.set(EnvironmentVariableUtils.java:49)
        at org.junitpioneer.jupiter.EnvironmentVariableExtensionTests.globalSetUp(EnvironmentVariableExtensionTests.java:34)

123 tests completed, 1 failed, 1 skipped


So I kept it in because I think it is handy but It is not required. I needed this because I have only a Windows os to test.
replies.author: Hancho2009

timeline.bodyText: I think we need a clearer warning that this uses reflection and may technically break on any minor Java release or on different OSes. Users should be aware that while this may be the best way to test env variables, it's not actually a good one. ;)
timeline.author: nipafx
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,60 @@
+:page-title: @ClearEnvironmentVariable and @SetEnvironmentVariable
+:page-description: JUnit Jupiter extensions to clear and set the values of environment variable
+
+The `@ClearEnvironmentVariable` and `@SetEnvironmentVariable` annotations can be used to clear, respectively, set the values of environment variables for a test execution.
+Both annotations work on the test method and class level, are repeatable as well as combinable.
+After the annotated method has been executed, the variables mentioned in the annotation will be restored to their original value or will be cleared if they didn't have one before.
+Other environment variables that are changed during the test, are *not* restored.
+
+Warning: Your SecurityManager has to allow modifications.

replies.bodyText:
You mentioned  in #174


put a warning into the .adoc
put a warning into the Javadoc
print a warning once per test suite/class/method (?) execution if the extension is active


I did not know excatly how much you wanted here (and where for the last point).
Would it be okay if you do that?
replies.author: Hancho2009

timeline.author: nipafx

replies.bodyText: Same as Linux as far as I can tell.
replies.author: Hancho2009

timeline.bodyText: I don't think this should be public API. Was that an accident or on purpose?
timeline.author: nipafx
Hancho2009

replies.author: Hancho2009

replies.bodyText:
(A) Great catch about the first exception, which went missing. Adding it as suppressed to the second exception looks right to me because the code that lead to the second exception did indeed suppress the first.
(B) I would still add the second exception as cause to the final (third) one because that causal chain represents well what actually happened.
As far as I can tell the code still does (A) and I would keep it that way.
replies.author: nipafx

timeline.bodyText: that is new to me - cool change
timeline.author: Hancho2009

timeline.bodyText: Okay, so, I think this might be causing issues on osx?

@@ -1,9 +1,19 @@

 jdk:

replies.bodyText:
Seems to work. it should be removed anyway #174 (comment)
What I do not understand is that it once worked with macOS and oraclejdk11 https://travis-ci.org/junit-pioneer/junit-pioneer/builds/652682481
Job Config: https://travis-ci.org/github/junit-pioneer/junit-pioneer/jobs/652682485/config
replies.author: Hancho2009

replies.bodyText: travis_fold:start:install_jdk was completely missing from the breaking build. It looked like Travis just skipped a step? Don't know why.
replies.author: Michael1993

timeline.bodyText: What do you think about the increased visibility?
timeline.author: nipafx

replies.bodyText: I write all my classes package private to access them in tests
replies.author: Bukama

timeline.bodyText: A bit weird to add this method just for tests. What do you think?
timeline.author: nipafx

replies.bodyText: I don't like methods in prod code just for tests.
replies.author: Bukama

replies.bodyText: Me neither. Fixed it by making the field accessible, so this can be done directly by the tests. (Doesn't really change anything functionally, but not having that method there just feels better. 😁 )
replies.author: nipafx

timeline.message:
resolves #167
Add new annotations ClearEnvironmentVariable and SetEnvironmentVariable.

#167
put a warning into the .adoc
put a warning into the Javadoc

#167
replace spaces with tab
Apply new formatter

Update .travis.yml

#167 add different os to travis ci config because environment variables can be implemented differently

Update .travis.yml

add oraclejdk8

Update build.gradle.kts

configure test logging to full exceptionFormat

gradle set ExceptionFormat to full

correct gradle kotlin style to set ExceptionFormat to full

add NullPointerException catch

to better understand why the tests fail on linux and osx

fix for Linux

System.getenv() retruns an object from which the field m needs to be aquired not from the class
fix paramter order and removed wrong condition

remove os windows and jdk oraclejdk8 for oraclejdk11 and also add exclude for osx

- the language 'java' is currently unsupported on the Windows Build Environment.
- osx install-jdk.sh Expected feature release number in range of 9 to 15
- linux oraclejdk8 install-jdk.sh Expected feature release number in range of 9 to 15
remove jobs exclude because travis ci disapeared from the pull request

add matrix exclude osx openjdk8

install-jdk.sh Expected feature release number in range of 9 to 15, but got: 8
use singel import
spotlessApply
minimal change to trigger travis ci
revert minimal change
Make smnall edits

- class should not be public api
- changed exception handling so no exception is hidden if could not modify environment variables
- adjust comment setInSystemEnvClass because it also works on osx

Revert "- class should not be public api"

This reverts commit 49ff6ee3d7a9ab53a953704efd0b3d1bcd148ab5.

CR

- class should not be public api …
- changed exception handling so no exception is hidden if could not modify environment variables
- adjust comment setInSystemEnvClass because it also works on osx

Update .travis.yml

remove oraclejdk11 because openjdk11 is probably very similar
Report warning once per test suite
Update to `PioneerAnnotationUtils`
Add reflection warning to documentation
Bump to version 0.6
Revert travis.yml changes (we use GitHub Actions now)
Remove method from `EnvironmentVariableExtension` (only existed for tests)
Suppress Sonar warnings
Use more general `ReflectiveOperationException`
